0: until nc -vz postgres16-rw.databases.svc.cluster.local 5432; do echo "Waiting for postgres..."; sleep 3; done;

mkdir -p /data/serverfiles/insurgency/cfg && cp /insserver.cfg /data/serverfiles/insurgency/cfg/insserver.cfg && cp /motd.txt /data/serverfiles/insurgency/motd.txt && chown -R 1000:1000 /data && echo "Setup complete"

[rack-ups]
  driver = "usbhid-ups"
  port = "auto"
  vendorid = "10AF"
  productid = "0001"
  product = "LiebertPSI"
  serial = ""
  vendor = "Emerson Network Power"
  bus = "002"

[upsmon]
  password  = "${SECRET_NUT_PASSWORD}"
  actions = SET
  instcmds = ALL
  upsmon primary

MONITOR rack-ups@localhost:3493 1 upsmon "${SECRET_NUT_PASSWORD}" primary
POLLFREQ 15
POLLFREQALERT 5
HOSTSYNC 15

#!/bin/bash
iptables -P INPUT ACCEPT
iptables -P OUTPUT ACCEPT
echo "true" > /iptables_setup

client
dev tun
proto udp
remote us-chicago.privacy.network 1198
resolv-retry infinite
nobind
persist-key
persist-tun
cipher aes-128-cbc
auth sha1
tls-client
remote-cert-tls server

auth-user-pass
compress
verb 1
reneg-sec 0
<crl-verify>

disable-occ

script-security 2
up /vpn/up.sh
if [ $(curl -s https://am.i.mullvad.net/ip) = '${SECRET_EXT_GATEWAY_IP}' ]; then exit 0; else exit $?; fi

/hr/ghcr.io-grafana-operator-helm-charts.title: loki helm release
/hr/ghcr.io-grafana-operator-helm-charts.name: loki
/hr/ghcr.io-grafana-operator-helm-charts.doc: Loki is a log aggregation system that aggregates logs from various sources, such as Kubernetes, and makes them available for search and analysis. It uses a label-based approach to categorize logs, making it easy to query and retrieve relevant logs. The system is designed to be horizontally scalable, highly available, and multi-tenant, making it suitable for use in a variety of environments, including home labs.
